summary: This document is an email chain among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutors discussing a draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein. The prosecutors debate the legal strategy of charging a single count covering all conduct versus separate counts per victim, and express concerns about making the indictment too sparse to instill public confidence and support a press conference.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as needing more material to work with at a press conference regarding the Epstein indictment.

events.title: Draft Indictment Review
events.description: A draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein is circulated among SDNY prosecutors for review, with discussions on its content and charging strategy.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors are drafting an indictment against Jeffrey Epstein in June 2019.
There is internal debate about whether to charge a single count covering all conduct or separate counts for each person trafficked, with concerns about legal strategy and public perception.
Prosecutors express a need to 'bulk up' the indictment to instill public confidence in the case's significance and seriousness, referencing 'the prior history'.
A goal is to give 'Geoff' more material for a press conference to further public confidence.
Prosecutors also aim to protect victims, especially those who remain anonymous, by keeping some facts sparse.
